21/*! \file bmstrsparsevec.h
22 \brief string sparse vector based on bit-transposed matrix

48/*!
49 \brief succinct sparse vector for strings with compression using bit-slicing ( transposition) method
50
51 Initial string is bit-transposed into bit-slices so collection may use less
52 memory due to prefix sum (GAP) compression in bit-slices. In addition, the container
53 can use chracter re-mapping using char freaquencies to compute the minimal codes.
54 Re-mapping can reduce memory footprint, get better search performance and improve storage
55 compression.
56
57 Template parameters:
58 CharType - type of character (char or unsigned char) (wchar not tested)
59 BV - bit-vector for bit-slicing
60 STR_SIZE - initial string size (can dynamically increase on usage)
61
62 @ingroup sv
63*/
64template<typename CharType, typename BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
65class str_sparse_vector : public base_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>
66{
67public:
68 typedef BV bvector_type;
69 typedef bvector_type* bvector_type_ptr;
70 typedef const bvector_type* bvector_type_const_ptr;
71 typedef CharType value_type;
72 typedef CharType* value_type_prt;
73 typedef typename bvector_type::size_type size_type;
74 typedef typename BV::allocator_type allocator_type;
75 typedef typename bvector_type::allocation_policy allocation_policy_type;
76 typedef typename bvector_type::enumerator bvector_enumerator_type;
77 typedef typename allocator_type::allocator_pool_type allocator_pool_type;
78 typedef bm::basic_bmatrix<BV> bmatrix_type;
79 typedef base_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE> parent_type;
80 typedef typename parent_type::unsigned_value_type unsigned_value_type;
81
82 /*! Statistical information about memory allocation details. */
83 struct statistics : public bv_statistics
84 {};
85
86 enum octet_slices
87 {
88 sv_octet_slices = STR_SIZE
89 };
90
91 /** Matrix of character remappings
92 @internal
93 */
94 typedef bm::dynamic_heap_matrix<unsigned char, allocator_type>
95 slice_octet_matrix_type;
96 typedef slice_octet_matrix_type remap_matrix_type;
97
98 /** Matrix of character frequencies (for optimal code remap)
99 @internal
100 */
101 typedef
102 bm::dynamic_heap_matrix<size_t, allocator_type> octet_freq_matrix_type;
103
104 struct is_remap_support { enum trait { value = true }; };
105 struct is_rsc_support { enum trait { value = false }; };
106 struct is_dynamic_splices { enum trait { value = true }; };
107
108 class reference_base
109 {
110 public:
111 typedef
112 bm::heap_vector<CharType, typename bvector_type::allocator_type, true>
113 bufffer_type;
114 protected:
115 mutable bufffer_type buf_;
116 };
117
118 /**
119 Reference class to access elements via common [] operator
120 @ingroup sv
121 */
122 class const_reference : protected reference_base
123 {
124 public:
125 const_reference(
126 const str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>& str_sv,
127 size_type idx)
128 : str_sv_(str_sv), idx_(idx)
129 {
130 this->buf_.resize(str_sv.effective_max_str());
131 }
132
133 operator const value_type*() const BMNOEXCEPT
134 {
135 return get();
136 }
137
138 const value_type* get() const BMNOEXCEPT
139 {
140 str_sv_.get(idx_, this->buf_.data(), str_sv_.effective_max_str());
141 return this->buf_.data();
142 }
143
144 bool operator==(const const_reference& ref) const BMNOEXCEPT
145 { return bool(*this) == bool(ref); }
146 bool is_null() const BMNOEXCEPT { return str_sv_.is_null(idx_); }
147 private:
148 const str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>& str_sv_;
149 size_type idx_;
150 };
151
152 /**
153 Reference class to access elements via common [] operator
154 @ingroup sv
155 */
156 class reference : protected reference_base
157 {
158 public:
159 reference(str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>& str_sv,
160 size_type idx)
161 : str_sv_(str_sv), idx_(idx)
162 {
163 this->buf_.resize(str_sv.effective_max_str());
164 }
165
166 operator const value_type*() const BMNOEXCEPT
167 {
168 return get();
169 }
170
171 const value_type* get() const BMNOEXCEPT
172 {
173 str_sv_.get(idx_, this->buf_.data(), str_sv_.effective_max_str());
174 return this->buf_.data();
175 }
176
177 reference& operator=(const reference& ref)
178 {
179 // TO DO: implement element copy bit by bit
180 str_sv_.set(idx_, (const value_type*)ref);
181 return *this;
182 }
183
184 reference& operator=(const value_type* str)
185 {
186 str_sv_.set(idx_, str);
187 return *this;
188 }
189 bool operator==(const reference& ref) const BMNOEXCEPT
190 { return bool(*this) == bool(ref); }
191 bool is_null() const BMNOEXCEPT { return str_sv_.is_null(idx_); }
192 private:
193 str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>& str_sv_;
194 size_type idx_;
195 };
196
197 /**
198 Const iterator to do quick traverse of the sparse vector.
199
200 Implementation uses buffer for decoding so, competing changes
201 to the original vector may not match the iterator returned values.
202
203 This iterator keeps an operational buffer of decoded elements, so memory footprint is NOT negligable.
204
205 @ingroup sv
206 */
207 class const_iterator
208 {
209 public:
210 friend class str_sparse_vector;
211#ifndef BM_NO_STL
212 typedef std::input_iterator_tag iterator_category;
213 typedef std::basic_string_view<CharType> string_view_type;
214#endif
215 typedef str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE> str_sparse_vector_type;
216 typedef str_sparse_vector_type* str_sparse_vector_type_ptr;
217 typedef typename str_sparse_vector_type::value_type value_type;
218 typedef typename str_sparse_vector_type::size_type size_type;
219 typedef typename str_sparse_vector_type::bvector_type bvector_type;
220 typedef typename bvector_type::allocator_type allocator_type;
221 typedef typename allocator_type::allocator_pool_type allocator_pool_type;
222
223 typedef long long difference_type;
224 typedef CharType* pointer;
225 typedef CharType*& reference;
226 public:
227 /**
228 Construct iterator (not attached to any particular vector)
229 */
230 const_iterator() BMNOEXCEPT;
231 /**
232 Construct iterator (attached to sparse vector)
233 @param sv - pointer to sparse vector
234 */
235 const_iterator(const str_sparse_vector_type* sv) BMNOEXCEPT;
236 /**
237 Construct iterator (attached to sparse vector) and positioned
238 @param sv - reference to sparse vector
239 @param pos - position in the vector to start
240 */
241 const_iterator(const str_sparse_vector_type* sv, size_type pos) BMNOEXCEPT;
242
243 const_iterator(const const_iterator& it) BMNOEXCEPT;
244
245 /**
246 setup iterator to retrieve a sub-string of a string
247 @param from - Position of the first character to be copied
248 @param len - length of a substring (defult: 0 read to the available end)
249 */
250 void set_substr(unsigned from, unsigned len = 0) BMNOEXCEPT;
251
252
253 bool operator==(const const_iterator& it) const BMNOEXCEPT
254 { return (pos_ == it.pos_) && (sv_ == it.sv_); }
255 bool operator!=(const const_iterator& it) const BMNOEXCEPT
256 { return ! operator==(it); }
257 bool operator < (const const_iterator& it) const BMNOEXCEPT
258 { return pos_ < it.pos_; }
259 bool operator <= (const const_iterator& it) const BMNOEXCEPT
260 { return pos_ <= it.pos_; }
261 bool operator > (const const_iterator& it) const BMNOEXCEPT
262 { return pos_ > it.pos_; }
263 bool operator >= (const const_iterator& it) const BMNOEXCEPT
264 { return pos_ >= it.pos_; }
265
266 /// \brief Get current position (value)
267 const value_type* operator*() const
268 { return this->value(); }
269
270 /// \brief Advance to the next available value
271 const_iterator& operator++() BMNOEXCEPT
272 { this->advance(); return *this; }
273
274 /// \brief Advance to the next available value
275 const_iterator& operator++(int) BMNOEXCEPT
276 { const_iterator tmp(*this);this->advance(); return tmp; }
277
278
279 /// \brief Get zero terminated string value at the current position
280 const value_type* value() const;
281
282 /// \brief Get current string as string_view
283 string_view_type get_string_view() const;
284
285 /// \brief Get NULL status
286 bool is_null() const BMNOEXCEPT { return sv_->is_null(this->pos_); }
287
288 /// Returns true if iterator is at a valid position
289 bool valid() const BMNOEXCEPT { return pos_ != bm::id_max; }
290
291 /// Invalidate current iterator
292 void invalidate() BMNOEXCEPT { pos_ = bm::id_max; }
293
294 /// Current position (index) in the vector
295 size_type pos() const BMNOEXCEPT { return pos_; }
296
297 /// re-position to a specified position
298 void go_to(size_type pos) BMNOEXCEPT;
299
300 /// advance iterator forward by one
301 void advance() BMNOEXCEPT;
302
303 protected:
304 enum buf_size_e
305 {
306 n_rows = 1024
307 };
308 typedef dynamic_heap_matrix<CharType, allocator_type> buffer_matrix_type;
309
310 private:
311 const str_sparse_vector_type* sv_; ///!< ptr to parent
312 unsigned substr_from_; ///!< substring from
313 unsigned substr_to_; ///!< substring to
314 mutable size_type pos_; ///!< Position
315 mutable buffer_matrix_type buf_matrix_; ///!< decode value buffer
316 mutable size_type pos_in_buf_; ///!< buffer position
317 };
318
319
320 /**
321 Back insert iterator implements buffered insert, faster than generic
322 access assignment.
323
324 Limitations for buffered inserter:
325 1. Do not use more than one inserter (into one vector) at the same time
326 2. Use method flush() at the end to send the rest of accumulated buffer
327 flush is happening automatically on destruction, but if flush produces an
328 exception (for whatever reason) it will be an exception in destructor.
329 As such, explicit flush() is safer way to finilize the sparse vector load.
330
331 @ingroup sv
332 */
333 class back_insert_iterator
334 {
335 public:
336#ifndef BM_NO_STL
337 typedef std::output_iterator_tag iterator_category;
338#endif
339 typedef str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE> str_sparse_vector_type;
340 typedef str_sparse_vector_type* str_sparse_vector_type_ptr;
341 typedef typename str_sparse_vector_type::value_type value_type;
342 typedef typename str_sparse_vector_type::size_type size_type;
343 typedef typename str_sparse_vector_type::bvector_type bvector_type;
344 typedef typename bvector_type::allocator_type allocator_type;
345 typedef typename allocator_type::allocator_pool_type allocator_pool_type;
346
347 typedef void difference_type;
348 typedef void pointer;
349 typedef void reference;
350
351 public:
352 back_insert_iterator() BMNOEXCEPT;
353 back_insert_iterator(str_sparse_vector_type* sv) BMNOEXCEPT;
354 back_insert_iterator(const back_insert_iterator& bi) BMNOEXCEPT;
355
356 back_insert_iterator& operator=(const back_insert_iterator& bi)
357 {
358 BM_ASSERT(bi.empty());
359 buf_matrix_.init_resize(
360 bi.buf_matrix_.rows(), bi.buf_matrix_.cols());
361 this->flush(); sv_ = bi.sv_;
362 return *this;
363 }
364
365 ~back_insert_iterator();
366
367 /** push value to the vector */
368 back_insert_iterator& operator=(const value_type* v)
369 { this->add(v); return *this; }
370
371
372 /** push value to the vector */
373 template<typename StrType>
374 back_insert_iterator& operator=(const StrType& v)
375 {
376 this->add(v.c_str()); return *this; // TODO: avoid c_str()
377 }
378
379 /** noop */
380 back_insert_iterator& operator*() { return *this; }
381 /** noop */
382 back_insert_iterator& operator++() { return *this; }
383 /** noop */
384 back_insert_iterator& operator++( int ) { return *this; }
385
386 /** add value to the container*/
387 void add(const value_type* v);
388
389 /** add NULL (no-value) to the container */
390 void add_null();
391
392 /** add a series of consequitve NULLs (no-value) to the container */
393 void add_null(size_type count);
394
395 /** flush the accumulated buffer */
396 void flush();
397 protected:
398 /** return true if insertion buffer is empty */
399 bool empty() const BMNOEXCEPT;
400
401 typedef typename bvector_type::block_idx_type block_idx_type;
402
403 /** add value to the buffer without changing the NULL vector
404 @param v - value to push back
405 @internal
406 */
407 void add_value(const value_type* v);
408
409 private:
410 enum buf_size_e
411 {
412 n_buf_size = str_sparse_vector_type::ins_buf_size // 1024 * 8
413 };
414 typedef bm::dynamic_heap_matrix<CharType, allocator_type> buffer_matrix_type;
415
416 private:
417 str_sparse_vector_type* sv_; ///!< pointer on the parent vector
418 bvector_type* bv_null_; ///!< not NULL vector pointer
419 buffer_matrix_type buf_matrix_; ///!< value buffer
420 size_type pos_in_buf_; ///!< buffer position
421 block_idx_type prev_nb_; ///!< previous block added
422 };
423
424
425public:
426
427 /*!
428 \brief Sparse vector constructor
429
430 \param null_able - defines if vector supports NULL values flag
431 by default it is OFF, use bm::use_null to enable it
432 \param ap - allocation strategy for underlying bit-vectors
433 Default allocation policy uses BM_BIT setting (fastest access)
434 \param bv_max_size - maximum possible size of underlying bit-vectors
435 Please note, this is NOT size of svector itself, it is dynamic upper limit
436 which should be used very carefully if we surely know the ultimate size
437 \param alloc - allocator for bit-vectors
438
439 \sa bvector<>
440 \sa bm::bvector<>::allocation_policy
441 \sa bm::startegy
442 */
443 str_sparse_vector(bm::null_support null_able = bm::no_null,
444 allocation_policy_type ap = allocation_policy_type(),
445 size_type bv_max_size = bm::id_max,
446 const allocator_type& alloc = allocator_type());
447
448 /*! copy-ctor */
449 str_sparse_vector(const str_sparse_vector& str_sv);
450
451 /*! copy assignmment operator */
452 str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>& operator = (
453 const str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>& str_sv)
454 {
455 if (this != &str_sv)
456 parent_type::copy_from(str_sv);
457 remap_flags_ = str_sv.remap_flags_;
458 remap_matrix1_ = str_sv.remap_matrix1_;
459 remap_matrix2_ = str_sv.remap_matrix2_;
460 return *this;
461 }
462#ifndef BM_NO_CXX11
463 /*! move-ctor */
464 str_sparse_vector(str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>&& str_sv) BMNOEXCEPT
465 {
466 parent_type::swap(str_sv);
467 remap_flags_ = str_sv.remap_flags_;
468 remap_matrix1_.swap(str_sv.remap_matrix1_);
469 remap_matrix2_.swap(str_sv.remap_matrix2_);
470 }
471
472 /*! move assignmment operator */
473 str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>& operator =
474 (str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>&& str_sv) BMNOEXCEPT
475 {
476 if (this != &str_sv)
477 {
478 this->swap(str_sv);
479 }
480 return *this;
481 }
482#endif
483
484public:
485
486 // ------------------------------------------------------------
487 /*! @name String element access */
488 ///@{
489
490 /** \brief Operator to get read access to an element */
491 const const_reference operator[](size_type idx) const
492 { return const_reference(*this, idx); }
493
494 /** \brief Operator to get write access to an element */
495 reference operator[](size_type idx) { return reference(*this, idx); }
496
497 /*!
498 \brief set specified element with bounds checking and automatic resize
499 \param idx - element index (vector auto-resized if needs to)
500 \param str - string to set (zero terminated)
501 */
502 void set(size_type idx, const value_type* str);
503
504 /*!
505 \brief set NULL status for the specified element
506 Vector is resized automatically
507 \param idx - element index (vector auto-resized if needs to)
508 */
509 void set_null(size_type idx);
510
511 /**
512 Set NULL all elements set as 1 in the argument vector
513 \param bv_idx - index bit-vector for elements which needs to be turned to NULL
514 */
515 void set_null(const bvector_type& bv_idx)
516 { this->bit_sub_rows(bv_idx, true); }
517
518 /**
519 Set vector elements spcified by argument bit-vector to empty
520 Note that set to empty elements are NOT going to tuned to NULL (NULL qualifier is preserved)
521 \param bv_idx - index bit-vector for elements which to be set to 0
522 */
523 void clear(const bvector_type& bv_idx)
524 { this->bit_sub_rows(bv_idx, false); }
525
526
527 /**
528 Set NULL all elements NOT set as 1 in the argument vector
529 \param bv_idx - index bit-vector for elements which needs to be kept
530 */
531 void keep(const bvector_type& bv_idx) { this->bit_and_rows(bv_idx); }
532
533
534 /*!
535 \brief insert the specified element
536 \param idx - element index (vector auto-resized if needs to)
537 \param str - string to set (zero terminated)
538 */
539 void insert(size_type idx, const value_type* str);
540
541
542 /*!
543 \brief insert STL string
544 \param idx - element index (vector auto-resized if needs to)
545 \param str - STL string to set
546 */
547 template<typename StrType>
548 void insert(size_type idx, const StrType& str)
549 {
550 this->insert(idx, str.c_str()); // TODO: avoid c_str()
551 }
552
553 /*!
554 \brief erase the specified element
555 \param idx - element index
556 */
557 void erase(size_type idx);
558
559 /*!
560 \brief get specified element
561
562 \param idx - element index
563 \param str - string buffer
564 \param buf_size - string buffer size
565
566 @return string length
567 */
568 size_type get(size_type idx,
569 value_type* str, size_type buf_size) const BMNOEXCEPT;
570
571 /*!
572 \brief set specified element with bounds checking and automatic resize
573
574 This is an equivalent of set() method, but templetized to be
575 more compatible with the STL std::string and the likes
576
577 \param idx - element index (vector auto-resized if needs to)
578 \param str - input string
579 expected an STL class with size() support,
580 like basic_string<> or vector<char>
581 */
582 template<typename StrType>
583 void assign(size_type idx, const StrType& str)
584 {
585 if (idx >= this->size())
586 this->size_ = idx+1;
587
588 size_type str_size = size_type(str.size());
589 if (!str_size)
590 {
591 this->clear_value_planes_from(0, idx);
592 return;
593 }
594 for (size_type i=0; i < str_size; ++i)
595 {
596 CharType ch = str[i];
597 if (remap_flags_) // compressional re-mapping is in effect
598 {
599 unsigned char remap_value = remap_matrix2_.get(i, unsigned(ch));
600 BM_ASSERT(remap_value);
601 ch = CharType(remap_value);
602 }
603 this->bmatr_.set_octet(idx, i, (unsigned char)ch);
604 if (!ch)
605 break;
606 } // for i
607 this->clear_value_planes_from(unsigned(str_size*8), idx);
608 if (bvector_type* bv_null = this->get_null_bvect())
609 bv_null->set_bit_no_check(idx);
610 }
611
612 /*!
613 \brief push back a string
614 \param str - string to set
615 (STL class with size() support, like basic_string)
616 */
617 template<typename StrType>
618 void push_back(const StrType& str) { assign(this->size_, str); }
619
620 /*!
621 \brief push back a string (zero terminated)
622 \param str - string to set
623 */
624 void push_back(const value_type* str) { set(this->size_, str); }
625
626 /*!
627 \brief push back specified amount of NULL values
628 \param count - number of NULLs to push back
629 */
630 void push_back_null(size_type count);
631
632 /*!
633 \brief push back NULL value
634 */
635 void push_back_null() { push_back_null(1); }
636
637 /*!
638 \brief get specified string element if NOT NULL
639 Template method expects an STL-compatible type basic_string<>
640 \param idx - element index (vector auto-resized if needs to)
641 \param str - string to get [out]
642 \return true if element is not null and try-get successfull
643 */
644 template<typename StrType>
645 bool try_get(size_type idx, StrType& str) const
646 {
647 if (this->is_null(idx))
648 return false;
649 get(idx, str);
650 return true;
651 }
652
653
654 /*!
655 \brief get specified string element
656 Template method expects an STL-compatible type basic_string<>
657 \param idx - element index (vector auto-resized if needs to)
658 \param str - string to get [out]
659 */
660 template<typename StrType>
661 void get(size_type idx, StrType& str) const
662 {
663 str.clear();
664 for (unsigned i = 0; true; ++i)
665 {
666 CharType ch = CharType(this->bmatr_.get_octet(idx, i));
667 if (!ch)
668 break;
669 if (remap_flags_)
670 {
671 const unsigned char* remap_row = remap_matrix1_.row(i);
672 unsigned char remap_value = remap_row[unsigned(ch)];
673 BM_ASSERT(remap_value);
674 if (!remap_value) // unknown dictionary element
675 {
676 throw_bad_value(0);
677 break;
678 }
679 ch = CharType(remap_value);
680 }
681 str.push_back(ch);
682 } // for i
683 }
684
685 /*! Swap content */
686 void swap(str_sparse_vector& str_sv) BMNOEXCEPT;
687
688 ///@}
689
690 // ------------------------------------------------------------
691 /*! @name Element comparison functions */
692 ///@{
693
694 /**
695 \brief Compare vector element with argument lexicographically
696
697 The function does not account for NULL values, NULL element is treated as an empty string
698
699 NOTE: for a re-mapped container, input string may have no correct
700 remapping, in this case we have an ambiguity
701 (we know it is not equal (0) but LT or GT?).
702 Behavior is undefined.
703
704 \param idx - vactor element index
705 \param str - argument to compare with
706
707 \return 0 - equal, < 0 - vect[idx] < str, >0 otherwise
708 */
709 int compare(size_type idx, const value_type* str) const BMNOEXCEPT;
710
711 /**
712 \brief Compare two vector elements
713
714 The function does not account for NULL values, NULL element is treated as an empty string
715 \param idx1 - vactor element index 1
716 \param idx2 - vactor element index 2
717
718 \return 0 - equal, < 0 - vect[idx1] < vect[idx2], >0 otherwise
719 */
720 int compare(size_type idx1, size_type idx2) const BMNOEXCEPT;
721
722
723 /**
724 \brief Find size of common prefix between two vector elements in octets
725 \return size of common prefix
726 */
727 unsigned common_prefix_length(size_type idx1, size_type idx2) const BMNOEXCEPT;
728
729 /**
730 Variant of compare for remapped vectors. Caller MUST guarantee vector is remapped.
731 */
732 int compare_remap(size_type idx, const value_type* str) const BMNOEXCEPT;
733
734 /**
735 Variant of compare for non-mapped vectors. Caller MUST guarantee vector is not remapped.
736 */
737 int compare_nomap(size_type idx, const value_type* str) const BMNOEXCEPT;
738
739 ///@}
740
741
742 // ------------------------------------------------------------
743 /*! @name Clear */
744 ///@{
745
746 /*! \brief resize to zero, free memory */
747 void clear_all(bool free_mem) BMNOEXCEPT;
748
749 /*! \brief resize to zero, free memory */
750 void clear() BMNOEXCEPT { clear_all(true); }
751
752 /*!
753 \brief clear range (assign bit 0 for all planes)
754 \param left - interval start
755 \param right - interval end (closed interval)
756 \param set_null - set cleared values to unassigned (NULL)
757 */
758 str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>&
759 clear_range(size_type left, size_type right, bool set_null = false)
760 {
761 parent_type::clear_range(left, right, set_null);
762 return *this;
763 }
764
765
766 ///@}
767
768
769 // ------------------------------------------------------------
770 /*! @name Size, etc */
771 ///@{
772
773 /*! \brief return size of the vector
774 \return size of sparse vector
775 */
776 size_type size() const { return this->size_; }
777
778 /*! \brief return true if vector is empty
779 \return true if empty
780 */
781 bool empty() const { return (size() == 0); }
782
783 /*! \brief resize vector
784 \param sz - new size
785 */
786 void resize(size_type sz) { parent_type::resize(sz, true); }
787
788 /*! \brief get maximum string length capacity
789 \return maximum string length sparse vector can take
790 */
791 static size_type max_str() { return sv_octet_slices; }
792
793 /*! \brief get effective string length used in vector
794 Calculate and returns efficiency, how close are we
795 to the reserved maximum.
796 \return current string length maximum
797 */
798 size_type effective_max_str() const BMNOEXCEPT;
799
800 /*! \brief get effective string length used in vector
801 \return current string length maximum
802 */
803 size_type effective_vector_max() const { return effective_max_str(); }
804
805 /**
806 \brief recalculate size to exclude tail NULL elements
807 After this call size() will return the true size of the vector
808 */
809 void sync_size() BMNOEXCEPT;
810
811 ///@}
812
813
814 // ------------------------------------------------------------
815 /*! @name Memory optimization/compression */
816 ///@{
817
818 /*!
819 \brief run memory optimization for all vector planes
820 \param temp_block - pre-allocated memory block to avoid unnecessary re-allocs
821 \param opt_mode - requested compression depth
822 \param stat - memory allocation statistics after optimization
823 */
824 void optimize(
825 bm::word_t* temp_block = 0,
826 typename bvector_type::optmode opt_mode = bvector_type::opt_compress,
827 typename str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::statistics* stat = 0);
828
829 /*!
830 @brief Calculates memory statistics.
831
832 Function fills statistics structure containing information about how
833 this vector uses memory and estimation of max. amount of memory
834 bvector needs to serialize itself.
835
836 @param st - pointer on statistics structure to be filled in.
837
838 @sa statistics
839 */
840 void calc_stat(
841 struct str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::statistics* st
842 ) const BMNOEXCEPT;
843
844 /**
845 @brief Turn sparse vector into immutable mode
846 Read-only (immutable) vector uses less memory and allows faster searches.
847 Before freezing it is recommenede to call optimize() to get full memory saving effect
848 @sa optimize, remap
849 */
850 void freeze() { this->freeze_matr(); }
851
852 /** Returns true if vector is read-only */
853 bool is_ro() const BMNOEXCEPT { return this->is_ro_; }
854
855 ///@}
856
857 // ------------------------------------------------------------
858 /*! @name Iterator access */
859 ///@{
860
861 /** Provide const iterator access to container content */
862 const_iterator begin() const BMNOEXCEPT;
863
864 /** Provide const iterator access to the end */
865 const_iterator end() const BMNOEXCEPT { return const_iterator(this, bm::id_max); }
866
867 /** Get const_itertor re-positioned to specific element
868 @param idx - position in the sparse vector
869 */
870 const_iterator get_const_iterator(size_type idx) const BMNOEXCEPT
871 { return const_iterator(this, idx); }
872
873 /** Provide back insert iterator
874 Back insert iterator implements buffered insertion, which is faster, than random access
875 or push_back
876 */
877 back_insert_iterator get_back_inserter()
878 { return back_insert_iterator(this); }
879
880 ///@}
881
882
883
884 // ------------------------------------------------------------
885 /*! @name Various traits */
886 ///@{
887
888 /** \brief various type traits
889 */
890 static constexpr
891 bool is_compressed() BMNOEXCEPT { return false; }
892
893 static constexpr
894 bool is_str() BMNOEXCEPT { return true; }
895
896 ///@}
897
898 // ------------------------------------------------------------
899 /*! @name Char remapping, succinct utilities
900
901 Remapping runs character usage analysis (frequency analysis)
902 based on that implements reduction of dit-depth thus improves
903 search performance and memory usage (both RAM and serialized).
904
905 Remapping limits farther modifications of sparse vector.
906 (Use remapped vector as read-only).
907 */
908
909 ///@{
910
911 /**
912 Get character remapping status (true | false)
913 */
914 bool is_remap() const BMNOEXCEPT { return remap_flags_ != 0; }
915
916 /**
917 Build remapping profile and load content from another sparse vector
918 Remapped vector likely saves memory (both RAM and disk) but
919 should not be modified (should be read-only).
920
921 \param str_sv - source sparse vector (assumed it is not remapped)
922 \so remap, freeze
923 */
924 void remap_from(const str_sparse_vector& str_sv);
925
926 /**
927 Build remapping profile and re-load content to save memory
928 */
929 void remap();
930
931 /*!
932 Calculate flags which octets are present on each byte-plane.
933 @internal
934 */
935 void calc_octet_stat(octet_freq_matrix_type& octet_matrix) const;
936
937 /*!
938 Compute optimal remap codes
939 @internal
940 */
941 void build_octet_remap(
942 slice_octet_matrix_type& octet_remap_matrix1,
943 slice_octet_matrix_type& octet_remap_matrix2,
944 octet_freq_matrix_type& octet_occupancy_matrix) const;
945 /*!
946 remap string from external (ASCII) system to matrix internal code
947 @return true if remapping was ok, false if found incorrect value
948 for the plane
949 @internal
950 */
951 static
952 bool remap_tosv(value_type* BMRESTRICT sv_str,
953 size_type buf_size,
954 const value_type* BMRESTRICT str,
955 const slice_octet_matrix_type& BMRESTRICT octet_remap_matrix2
956 ) BMNOEXCEPT;
957
958 /*!
959 remap string from external (ASCII) system to matrix internal code
960 @internal
961 */
962 bool remap_tosv(value_type* sv_str,
963 size_type buf_size,
964 const value_type* str) const BMNOEXCEPT
965 {
966 return remap_tosv(sv_str, buf_size, str, remap_matrix2_);
967 }
968 /*!
969 remap string from internal code to external (ASCII) system
970 @return true if remapping was ok, false if found incorrect value
971 for the plane
972 @internal
973 */
974 static
975 bool remap_fromsv(
976 value_type* BMRESTRICT str,
977 size_type buf_size,
978 const value_type* BMRESTRICT sv_str,
979 const slice_octet_matrix_type& BMRESTRICT octet_remap_matrix1
980 ) BMNOEXCEPT;
981 /*!
982 re-calculate remap matrix2 based on matrix1
983 @internal
984 */
985 void recalc_remap_matrix2();
986
987 ///@}
988
989 // ------------------------------------------------------------
990 /*! @name Export content to C-style */
991 ///@{
992
993 /**
994 \brief Bulk export strings to a C-style matrix of chars
995
996 \param cmatr - dest matrix (bm::heap_matrix)
997 \param idx_from - index in the sparse vector to export from
998 \param dec_size - decoding size (matrix column allocation should match)
999 \param zero_mem - set to false if target array is pre-initialized
1000 with 0s to avoid performance penalty
1001
1002 \return number of actually exported elements (can be less than requested)
1003 */
1004 template<typename CharMatrix>
1005 size_type decode(CharMatrix& cmatr,
1006 size_type idx_from,
1007 size_type dec_size,
1008 bool zero_mem = true) const
1009 {
1010 size_type str_len = effective_max_str();
1011 return decode_substr(cmatr, idx_from, dec_size,
1012 0, unsigned(str_len-1), zero_mem);
1013 }
1014
1015 /**
1016 \brief Bulk export strings to a C-style matrix of chars
1017
1018 \param cmatr - dest matrix (bm::heap_matrix)
1019 \param idx_from - index in the sparse vector to export from
1020 \param dec_size - decoding size (matrix column allocation should match)
1021 \param substr_from - sub-string position from
1022 \param substr_to - sub-string position to
1023 \param zero_mem - set to false if target array is pre-initialized
1024 with 0s to avoid performance penalty
1025
1026 \return number of actually exported elements (can be less than requested)
1027 */
1028 template<typename CharMatrix>
1029 size_type decode_substr(CharMatrix& cmatr,
1030 size_type idx_from,
1031 size_type dec_size,
1032 unsigned substr_from,
1033 unsigned substr_to,
1034 bool zero_mem = true) const
1035 {
1036
1037 /// Decoder functor
1038 /// @internal
1039 ///
1040 struct sv_decode_visitor_func
1041 {
1042 sv_decode_visitor_func(CharMatrix& cmatr) BMNOEXCEPT2
1043 : cmatr_(cmatr), mask_(0), sv_off_(0)
1044 {}
1045
1046 int add_bits(size_type bv_offset,
1047 const unsigned char* BMRESTRICT bits, unsigned bits_size) BMNOEXCEPT
1048 {
1049 // can be negative (-1) when bv base offset = 0 and sv = 1,2..
1050 size_type base = bv_offset - sv_off_;
1051 unsigned_value_type m = mask_;
1052 const unsigned i = substr_i_;
1053 for (unsigned j = 0; j < bits_size; ++j)
1054 {
1055 size_type idx = bits[j] + base;
1056 value_type* BMRESTRICT str = cmatr_.row(idx);
1057 str[i] |= m;
1058 } // for i
1059 return 0;
1060 }
1061 int add_range(size_type bv_offset, size_type sz) BMNOEXCEPT
1062 {
1063 auto base = bv_offset - sv_off_;
1064 unsigned_value_type m = mask_;
1065 const unsigned i = substr_i_;
1066 for (size_type j = 0; j < sz; ++j)
1067 {
1068 size_type idx = j + base;
1069 value_type* BMRESTRICT str = cmatr_.row(idx);
1070 str[i] |= m;
1071 } // for i
1072 return 0;
1073 }
1074
1075 CharMatrix& cmatr_; ///< target array for reverse transpose
1076 unsigned_value_type mask_; ///< bit-plane mask
1077 unsigned substr_i_; ///< i
1078 size_type sv_off_; ///< SV read offset
1079 };
1080
1081
1082 BM_ASSERT(substr_from <= substr_to);
1083 BM_ASSERT(cmatr.is_init());
1084
1085 if (zero_mem)
1086 cmatr.set_zero(); // TODO: set zero based on requested capacity
1087
1088 size_type rows = size_type(cmatr.rows());
1089 size_type max_sz = this->size() - idx_from;
1090 if (max_sz < dec_size)
1091 dec_size = max_sz;
1092 if (rows < dec_size)
1093 dec_size = rows;
1094 if (!dec_size)
1095 return dec_size;
1096
1097 sv_decode_visitor_func func(cmatr);
1098
1099 for (unsigned i = substr_from; i <= substr_to; ++i)
1100 {
1101 unsigned bi = 0;
1102 func.substr_i_ = i - substr_from; // to put substr at the str[0]
1103
1104 auto rsize = this->bmatr_.rows_not_null();
1105 for (unsigned k = i * 8; k < (i * 8) + 8; ++k, ++bi)
1106 {
1107 if (k >= rsize)
1108 goto break2;
1109 const bvector_type* bv = this->bmatr_.get_row(k);
1110 if (!bv)
1111 continue;
1112 BM_ASSERT (bv != this->get_null_bvector());
1113
1114 func.mask_ = unsigned_value_type(1u << bi);
1115 func.sv_off_ = idx_from;
1116
1117 size_type end = idx_from + dec_size;
1118 bm::for_each_bit_range_no_check(*bv, idx_from, end-1, func);
1119
1120 } // for k
1121 } // for i
1122 break2:
1123
1124 if (remap_flags_)
1125 {
1126 for (unsigned i = 0; i < dec_size; ++i)
1127 {
1128 typename CharMatrix::value_type* str = cmatr.row(i);
1129 remap_matrix1_.remapz(str);
1130 } // for i
1131 }
1132 return dec_size;
1133 }
1134
1135 /**
1136 \brief Bulk import of strings from a C-style matrix of chars
1137
1138 \param cmatr - source matrix (bm::heap_matrix)
1139 [in/out] parameter gets modified(corrupted)
1140 in the process
1141 \param idx_from - destination index in the sparse vector
1142 \param imp_size - import size (number or rows to import)
1143 */
1144 template<typename CharMatrix>
1145 void import(CharMatrix& cmatr, size_type idx_from, size_type imp_size)
1146 {
1147 if (!imp_size)
1148 return;
1149 if (idx_from < this->size_) // in case it touches existing elements
1150 {
1151 // clear all planes in the range to provide corrrect import of 0 values
1152 this->clear_range(idx_from, idx_from + imp_size - 1);
1153 }
1154 import_no_check(cmatr, idx_from, imp_size);
1155 }
1156
1157 /**
1158 \brief Bulk push-back import of strings from a C-style matrix of chars
1159
1160 \param cmatr - source matrix (bm::heap_matrix)
1161 [in/out] parameter gets modified(corrupted)
1162 in the process
1163 \param imp_size - import size (number or rows to import)
1164 */
1165 template<typename CharMatrix>
1166 void import_back(CharMatrix& cmatr, size_type imp_size)
1167 {
1168 if (!imp_size)
1169 return;
1170 import_no_check(cmatr, this->size(), imp_size);
1171 }
1172
1173
1174 ///@}
1175
1176 // ------------------------------------------------------------
1177 /*! @name Merge, split, partition data */
1178 ///@{
1179
1180 /**
1181 @brief copy range of values from another sparse vector
1182
1183 Copy [left..right] values from the source vector,
1184 clear everything outside the range.
1185
1186 \param sv - source vector
1187 \param left - index from in losed diapason of [left..right]
1188 \param right - index to in losed diapason of [left..right]
1189 \param slice_null - "use_null" copy range for NULL vector or
1190 do not copy it
1191 */
1192 void copy_range(const str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>& sv,
1193 size_type left, size_type right,
1194 bm::null_support slice_null = bm::use_null);
1195
1196 /**
1197 \brief merge with another sparse vector using OR operation
1198 Merge is different from join(), because it borrows data from the source
1199 vector, so it gets modified (destructive join)
1200
1201 \param tr_sv - [in, out]argument vector to join with (vector mutates)
1202
1203 \return self reference
1204 */
1205 str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>&
1206 merge(str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>& str_sv);
1207
1208 /**
1209 Keep only specified interval in the sparse vector, clear all other
1210 elements.
1211
1212 \param left - interval start
1213 \param right - interval end (closed interval)
1214 \param slice_null - "use_null" copy range for NULL vector or not
1215 */
1216 void keep_range(size_type left, size_type right,
1217 bm::null_support slice_null = bm::use_null);
1218
1219 ///@}
1220
1221 // ------------------------------------------------------------
1222
1223 /*! \brief syncronize internal structures */
1224 void sync(bool force);
1225
1226 /*!
1227 \brief check if another sparse vector has the same content and size
1228
1229 \param sv - sparse vector for comparison
1230 \param null_able - flag to consider NULL vector in comparison (default)
1231 or compare only value content planes
1232
1233 \return true, if it is the same
1234 */
1235 bool equal(const str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>& sv,
1236 bm::null_support null_able = bm::use_null) const BMNOEXCEPT;
1237
1238 /**
1239 \brief find position of compressed element by its rank
1240 */
1241 static
1242 bool find_rank(size_type rank, size_type& pos) BMNOEXCEPT;
1243
1244 /**
1245 \brief size of sparse vector (may be different for RSC)
1246 */
1247 size_type effective_size() const BMNOEXCEPT { return size(); }
1248
1249protected:
1250 enum insert_buf_size_e
1251 {
1252 ins_buf_size = 1024 * 8
1253 };
1254
1255 /// @internal
1256 template<typename CharMatrix, size_t BufSize = ins_buf_size>
1257 void import_no_check(CharMatrix& cmatr,
1258 size_type idx_from, size_type imp_size,
1259 bool set_not_null = true)
1260 {
1261 BM_ASSERT (cmatr.is_init());
1262
1263 unsigned max_str_size = 0;
1264 {
1265 for (unsigned j = 0; j < imp_size; ++j)
1266 {
1267 typename CharMatrix::value_type* str = cmatr.row(j);
1268 typename CharMatrix::size_type i;
1269 typename CharMatrix::size_type cols = cmatr.cols();
1270 for (i = 0; i < cols; ++i)
1271 {
1272 value_type ch = str[i];
1273 if (!ch)
1274 {
1275 max_str_size =
1276 (unsigned)((i > max_str_size) ? i : max_str_size);
1277 break;
1278 }
1279 if (remap_flags_) // re-mapping is in effect
1280 {
1281 unsigned char remap_value =
1282 remap_matrix2_.get(i, (unsigned char)(ch));
1283 BM_ASSERT(remap_value); // unknown ?!
1284 /*
1285 if (!remap_value) // unknown dictionary element
1286 throw_bad_value(0); */
1287 str[i] = CharType(remap_value);
1288 }
1289 } // for i
1290 } // for j
1291 }
1292
1293 this->bmatr_.allocate_rows((1+max_str_size) * 8 + this->is_nullable());
1294
1295 unsigned_value_type ch_slice[BufSize];
1296 for (unsigned i = 0; i < max_str_size; ++i)
1297 {
1298 unsigned ch_acc = 0;
1299#if defined(BMVECTOPT) || defined(BM_USE_GCC_BUILD)
1300 if (imp_size == ins_buf_size) /// full buffer import can use loop unrolling
1301 {
1302 for (size_type j = 0; j < imp_size; j+=4)
1303 {
1304 unsigned_value_type ch0 = (unsigned_value_type)cmatr.row(j)[i];
1305 unsigned_value_type ch1 = (unsigned_value_type)cmatr.row(j+1)[i];
1306 unsigned_value_type ch2 = (unsigned_value_type)cmatr.row(j+2)[i];
1307 unsigned_value_type ch3 = (unsigned_value_type)cmatr.row(j+3)[i];
1308
1309 ch_acc |= ch0 | ch1 | ch2 | ch3;
1310 ch_slice[j] = ch0; ch_slice[j+1] = ch1;
1311 ch_slice[j+2] = ch2; ch_slice[j+3] = ch3;
1312 }
1313 }
1314 else
1315#endif
1316 {
1317 for (size_type j = 0; j < imp_size; ++j)
1318 {
1319 unsigned_value_type ch = (unsigned_value_type)cmatr.row(j)[i];
1320 ch_acc |= ch;
1321 ch_slice[j] = ch;
1322 }
1323 }
1324 import_char_slice(ch_slice, ch_acc, i, idx_from, imp_size);
1325 }
1326
1327 size_type idx_to = idx_from + imp_size - 1;
1328 if (set_not_null)
1329 {
1330 if (bvector_type* bv_null = this->get_null_bvect())
1331 bv_null->set_range(idx_from, idx_to);
1332 }
1333 if (idx_to >= this->size())
1334 this->size_ = idx_to+1;
1335
1336 }
1337#ifdef _MSC_VER
1338#pragma warning( push )
1339#pragma warning( disable : 4146 )
1340#endif
1341 /// @internal
1342 template<size_t BufSize = ins_buf_size>
1343 void import_char_slice(const unsigned_value_type* ch_slice,
1344 unsigned ch_acc,
1345 size_type char_slice_idx,
1346 size_type idx_from, size_type imp_size)
1347 {
1348 size_type bit_list[BufSize];
1349 for ( ;ch_acc; ch_acc &= ch_acc - 1) // bit-scan
1350 {
1351 unsigned n_bits = 0;
1352 const unsigned bi = (bm::word_bitcount((ch_acc & -ch_acc) - 1));
1353 unsigned mask = 1u << bi;
1354#if defined(BMVECTOPT) || defined(BM_USE_GCC_BUILD)
1355 if (imp_size == ins_buf_size) /// full buffer import can use loop unrolling
1356 {
1357 mask |= (mask << 8) | (mask << 16) | (mask << 24);
1358 for (size_type j = 0; j < imp_size; j+=4)
1359 {
1360 unsigned ch0 = ((unsigned)ch_slice[j+0]) |
1361 ((unsigned)ch_slice[j+1] << 8) |
1362 ((unsigned)ch_slice[j+2] << 16) |
1363 ((unsigned)ch_slice[j+3] << 24);
1364 ch0 &= mask;
1365 ch0 = (ch0 >> bi) | (ch0 >> (bi+7)) |
1366 (ch0 >> (bi+14)) | (ch0 >> (bi+21));
1367 ch0 &= 15u;
1368 BM_ASSERT(bm::word_bitcount(ch0) <= 4);
1369 for (size_type base_idx = idx_from + j ;ch0; ch0 &= ch0 - 1) // bit-scan
1370 {
1371 const unsigned bit_idx =
1372 (bm::word_bitcount((ch0 & -ch0) - 1));
1373 bit_list[n_bits++] = base_idx + bit_idx;
1374 } // for ch0
1375 } // for j
1376 }
1377 else
1378#endif
1379 {
1380 for (size_type j = 0; j < imp_size; ++j)
1381 {
1382 unsigned ch = unsigned(ch_slice[j]);
1383 if (ch & mask)
1384 bit_list[n_bits++] = idx_from + j;
1385 } // for j
1386 }
1387
1388 if (n_bits) // set transposed bits to the target plane
1389 {
1390 bvector_type* bv =
1391 this->get_create_slice((unsigned)(char_slice_idx * 8) + bi);
1392 bv->import_sorted(&bit_list[0], n_bits);
1393 }
1394 } // for ch_acc
1395 }
1396#ifdef _MSC_VER
1397#pragma warning( pop )
1398#endif
1399 // ------------------------------------------------------------
1400 /*! @name Errors and exceptions */
1401 ///@{
1402
1403 /**
1404 \brief throw range error
1405 \internal
1406 */
1407 static
1408 void throw_range_error(const char* err_msg);
1409
1410 /**
1411 \brief throw domain error
1412 \internal
1413 */
1414 static
1415 void throw_bad_value(const char* err_msg);
1416
1417 ///@}
1418
1419 /*! \brief set value without checking boundaries */
1420 void set_value(size_type idx, const value_type* str);
1421
1422 /*! \brief set value without checking boundaries or support of NULL */
1423 void set_value_no_null(size_type idx, const value_type* str);
1424
1425 /*! \brief insert value without checking boundaries */
1426 void insert_value(size_type idx, const value_type* str);
1427
1428 /*! \brief insert value without checking boundaries or support of NULL */
1429 void insert_value_no_null(size_type idx, const value_type* str);
1430
1431
1432 size_type size_internal() const { return size(); }
1433 void resize_internal(size_type sz) { resize(sz); }
1434
1435 size_t remap_size() const { return remap_matrix1_.get_buffer().size(); }
1436 const unsigned char* get_remap_buffer() const
1437 { return remap_matrix1_.get_buffer().buf(); }
1438 unsigned char* init_remap_buffer()
1439 {
1440 remap_matrix1_.init(true);
1441 return remap_matrix1_.get_buffer().data();
1442 }
1443 void set_remap() { remap_flags_ = 1; }
1444
1445protected:
1446
1447 bool resolve_range(size_type from, size_type to,
1448 size_type* idx_from, size_type* idx_to) const
1449 {
1450 *idx_from = from; *idx_to = to; return true;
1451 }
1452
1453 const remap_matrix_type* get_remap_matrix() const
1454 { return &remap_matrix1_; }
1455 remap_matrix_type* get_remap_matrix()
1456 { return &remap_matrix1_; }
1457
1458protected:
1459 template<class SVect> friend class sparse_vector_serializer;
1460 template<class SVect> friend class sparse_vector_deserializer;
1461
1462protected:
1463 unsigned remap_flags_; ///< remapping status
1464 slice_octet_matrix_type remap_matrix1_; ///< octet remap table 1
1465 slice_octet_matrix_type remap_matrix2_; ///< octet remap table 2
1466};
1467
1468//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1469//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1470
1471
1472template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
1473str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::str_sparse_vector(
1474 bm::null_support null_able,
1475 allocation_policy_type ap,
1476 size_type bv_max_size,
1477 const allocator_type& alloc)
1478: parent_type(null_able, ap, bv_max_size, alloc),
1479 remap_flags_(0)
1480{
1481 static_assert(STR_SIZE > 1,
1482 "BM:: String vector size must be > 1 (to accomodate 0 terminator)");
1483}
1484
1485
1486//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1487
1488template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
1489str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::str_sparse_vector(
1490 const str_sparse_vector& str_sv)
1491: parent_type(str_sv),
1492 remap_flags_(str_sv.remap_flags_),
1493 remap_matrix1_(str_sv.remap_matrix1_),
1494 remap_matrix2_(str_sv.remap_matrix2_)
1495{
1496 static_assert(STR_SIZE > 1,
1497 "BM:: String vector size must be > 1 (to accomodate 0 terminator)");
1498}
1499
1500//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1501
1502template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
1503void str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::swap(
1504 str_sparse_vector& str_sv) BMNOEXCEPT
1505{
1506 parent_type::swap(str_sv);
1507 bm::xor_swap(remap_flags_, str_sv.remap_flags_);
1508 remap_matrix1_.swap(str_sv.remap_matrix1_);
1509 remap_matrix2_.swap(str_sv.remap_matrix2_);
1510}
1511
1512//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1513
1514template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
1515void str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::set(
1516 size_type idx, const value_type* str)
1517{
1518 if (idx >= this->size())
1519 this->size_ = idx+1;
1520 set_value(idx, str);
1521}
1522
1523//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1524
1525template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
1526void str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::insert(
1527 size_type idx, const value_type* str)
1528{
1529 if (idx >= this->size())
1530 {
1531 this->size_ = idx+1;
1532 set_value(idx, str);
1533 return;
1534 }
1535 insert_value(idx, str);
1536 this->size_++;
1537}
1538
1539//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1540
1541template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
1542void str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::erase(size_type idx)
1543{
1544 BM_ASSERT(idx < this->size_);
1545 if (idx >= this->size_)
1546 return;
1547 this->erase_column(idx, true);
1548 this->size_--;
1549}
1550
1551//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1552
1553template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
1554void str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::set_null(size_type idx)
1555{
1556 if (idx >= this->size_)
1557 this->size_ = idx + 1; // assumed nothing todo outside current size
1558 else
1559 this->bmatr_.clear_column(idx, 0);
1560}
1561//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1562
1563template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
1564void str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::push_back_null(size_type count)
1565{
1566 BM_ASSERT(count);
1567 BM_ASSERT(bm::id_max - count > this->size_);
1568 BM_ASSERT(this->is_nullable());
1569
1570 this->size_ += count;
1571}
1572
1573//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1574
1575template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
1576void str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::set_value(
1577 size_type idx, const value_type* str)
1578{
1579 set_value_no_null(idx, str);
1580 if (bvector_type* bv_null = this->get_null_bvect())
1581 bv_null->set_bit_no_check(idx);
1582}
1583
1584//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1585
1586template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
1587void str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::set_value_no_null(
1588 size_type idx, const value_type* str)
1589{
1590 for (unsigned i = 0; true; ++i)
1591 {
1592 CharType ch = str[i];
1593 if (!ch)
1594 {
1595 this->clear_value_planes_from(i*8, idx);
1596 return;
1597 }
1598 if (remap_flags_) // compressional re-mapping is in effect
1599 {
1600 auto r = remap_matrix2_.rows();
1601 if (i >= r)
1602 {
1603 remap_matrix1_.resize(i + 1, remap_matrix1_.cols(), true);
1604 remap_matrix2_.resize(i + 1, remap_matrix2_.cols(), true);
1605 }
1606 unsigned char remap_value = remap_matrix2_.get(i, unsigned(ch));
1607 BM_ASSERT(remap_value);
1608 if (!remap_value) // unknown dictionary element
1609 {
1610 this->clear_value_planes_from(i*8, idx);
1611 return;
1612 }
1613 ch = CharType(remap_value);
1614 }
1615 this->bmatr_.set_octet(idx, i, (unsigned char)ch);
1616 } // for i
1617}
1618
1619//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1620
1621template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
1622void str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::insert_value(
1623 size_type idx, const value_type* str)
1624{
1625 insert_value_no_null(idx, str);
1626 this->insert_null(idx, true);
1627}
1628
1629//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1630
1631template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
1632void str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::insert_value_no_null(
1633 size_type idx, const value_type* str)
1634{
1635 for (unsigned i = 0; true; ++i)
1636 {
1637 CharType ch = str[i];
1638 if (!ch)
1639 {
1640 this->insert_clear_value_planes_from(i*8, idx);
1641 return;
1642 }
1643
1644 if (remap_flags_) // compressional re-mapping is in effect
1645 {
1646 unsigned char remap_value = remap_matrix2_.get(i, unsigned(ch));
1647 BM_ASSERT(remap_value);
1648 if (!remap_value) // unknown dictionary element
1649 {
1650 this->insert_clear_value_planes_from(i*8, idx);
1651 return;
1652 }
1653 ch = CharType(remap_value);
1654 }
1655 this->bmatr_.insert_octet(idx, i, (unsigned char)ch);
1656 } // for i
1657}
1658
1659
1660//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1661
1662template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
1663typename str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::size_type
1664str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::get(
1665 size_type idx, value_type* str, size_type buf_size) const BMNOEXCEPT
1666{
1667 size_type i = 0;
1668 for (; true; ++i)
1669 {
1670 if (i >= buf_size)
1671 break;
1672 CharType ch = CharType(this->bmatr_.get_octet(idx, i));
1673 str[i] = ch;
1674 if (!ch)
1675 break;
1676 }
1677 if (remap_flags_)
1678 remap_matrix1_.remap(str, i);
1679 return i;
1680}
1681
1682//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1683
1684template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
1685void str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::optimize(
1686 bm::word_t* temp_block,
1687 typename bvector_type::optmode opt_mode,
1688 typename str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::statistics* st)
1689{
1690 typename bvector_type::statistics stbv;
1691 parent_type::optimize(temp_block, opt_mode, &stbv);
1692
1693 if (st)
1694 st->add(stbv);
1695}
1696
1697//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1698
1699template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
1700void str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::calc_stat(
1701 struct str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::statistics* st
1702 ) const BMNOEXCEPT
1703{
1704 BM_ASSERT(st);
1705 typename bvector_type::statistics stbv;
1706 parent_type::calc_stat(&stbv);
1707
1708 st->reset();
1709
1710 st->bit_blocks += stbv.bit_blocks;
1711 st->gap_blocks += stbv.gap_blocks;
1712 st->ptr_sub_blocks += stbv.ptr_sub_blocks;
1713 st->bv_count += stbv.bv_count;
1714 st->max_serialize_mem += stbv.max_serialize_mem + 8;
1715 st->memory_used += stbv.memory_used;
1716 st->gap_cap_overhead += stbv.gap_cap_overhead;
1717
1718 size_t remap_mem_usage = sizeof(remap_flags_);
1719 remap_mem_usage += remap_matrix1_.get_buffer().mem_usage();
1720 remap_mem_usage += remap_matrix2_.get_buffer().mem_usage();
1721
1722 st->memory_used += remap_mem_usage;
1723 if (remap_flags_) // use of remapping requires some extra storage
1724 {
1725 st->max_serialize_mem += (remap_mem_usage * 2);
1726 }
1727}
1728
1729//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1730
1731template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
1732int str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::compare_remap(
1733 size_type idx, const value_type* str) const BMNOEXCEPT
1734{
1735 BM_ASSERT(str);
1736 BM_ASSERT(is_remap()); // MUST guarantee remapping
1737
1738 int res = 0;
1739 for (unsigned i = 0; true; ++i)
1740 {
1741 CharType octet2 = str[i];
1742 CharType octet1 = (CharType)this->bmatr_.get_octet(idx, i);
1743 if (!octet1)
1744 {
1745 res = -octet2; // -1 || 0
1746 break;
1747 }
1748 const unsigned char* remap_row = remap_matrix1_.row(i);
1749 unsigned char remap_value1 = remap_row[unsigned(octet1)];
1750 BM_ASSERT(remap_value1);
1751 res = (remap_value1 > octet2) - (remap_value1 < octet2);
1752 if (res || !octet2)
1753 break;
1754 } // for i
1755 return res;
1756}
1757
1758//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1759
1760template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
1761int str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::compare_nomap(size_type idx,
1762 const value_type* str) const BMNOEXCEPT
1763{
1764 BM_ASSERT(str);
1765 BM_ASSERT(!is_remap()); // MUST guarantee remapping
1766
1767 int res = 0;
1768 for (unsigned i = 0; true; ++i)
1769 {
1770 CharType octet2 = str[i];
1771 CharType octet1 = (CharType)this->bmatr_.get_octet(idx, i);
1772 if (!octet1)
1773 {
1774 res = -octet2; // -1 || 0
1775 break;
1776 }
1777 res = (octet1 > octet2) - (octet1 < octet2);
1778 if (res || !octet2)
1779 break;
1780 } // for i
1781 return res;
1782}
1783
1784
1785//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1786
1787template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
1788int str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::compare(
1789 size_type idx,
1790 const value_type* str) const BMNOEXCEPT
1791{
1792 BM_ASSERT(str);
1793 int res = remap_flags_ ? compare_remap(idx, str)
1794 : compare_nomap(idx, str);
1795 return res;
1796}
1797
1798//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1799
1800template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
1801int str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::compare(
1802 size_type idx1,
1803 size_type idx2) const BMNOEXCEPT
1804{
1805 int res = 0;
1806 if (idx1 == idx2)
1807 return 0;
1808 if (remap_flags_)
1809 {
1810 for (unsigned i = 0; true; ++i)
1811 {
1812 // TODO: implement function to return two octets at once
1813 CharType octet2 = (CharType)this->bmatr_.get_octet(idx2, i);
1814 CharType octet1 = (CharType)this->bmatr_.get_octet(idx1, i);
1815 if (!octet1)
1816 {
1817 res = -octet2; // -1 || 0
1818 break;
1819 }
1820 const unsigned char* remap_row = remap_matrix1_.row(i);
1821 unsigned char remap_value1 = remap_row[unsigned(octet1)];
1822 BM_ASSERT(remap_value1);
1823 unsigned char remap_value2 = remap_row[unsigned(octet2)];
1824 BM_ASSERT(remap_value2);
1825 res = (remap_value1 > remap_value2) - (remap_value1 < remap_value2);
1826 if (res || !octet2)
1827 break;
1828 } // for i
1829 }
1830 else
1831 {
1832 for (unsigned i = 0; true; ++i)
1833 {
1834 CharType octet2 = (CharType)this->bmatr_.get_octet(idx2, i);
1835 CharType octet1 = (CharType)this->bmatr_.get_octet(idx1, i);
1836 if (!octet1)
1837 {
1838 res = -octet2; // -1 || 0
1839 break;
1840 }
1841 res = (octet1 > octet2) - (octet1 < octet2);
1842 if (res || !octet2)
1843 break;
1844 } // for i
1845 }
1846 return res;
1847
1848}
1849
1850//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1851
1852template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
1853unsigned str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::common_prefix_length(
1854 size_type idx1, size_type idx2) const BMNOEXCEPT
1855{
1856 unsigned i = 0;
1857 for (; true; ++i)
1858 {
1859 CharType ch1 = CharType(this->bmatr_.get_octet(idx1, i));
1860 CharType ch2 = CharType(this->bmatr_.get_octet(idx2, i));
1861 if (!ch1 || !ch2)
1862 {
1863 if (i)
1864 --i;
1865 break;
1866 }
1867 if (ch1 != ch2)
1868 break;
1869 } // for
1870
1871 return i;
1872}
1873
1874//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1875
1876template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
1877bool
1878str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::find_rank(
1879 size_type rank,
1880 size_type& pos) BMNOEXCEPT
1881{
1882 BM_ASSERT(rank);
1883 pos = rank - 1;
1884 return true;
1885}
1886
1887//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1888
1889template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
1890typename str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::size_type
1891str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::effective_max_str()
1892 const BMNOEXCEPT
1893{
1894 return this->bmatr_.octet_size();
1895}
1896
1897//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1898
1899template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
1900void str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::calc_octet_stat(
1901 octet_freq_matrix_type& octet_matrix) const
1902{
1903 size_type max_str_len = effective_max_str();
1904 octet_matrix.resize(max_str_len, 256, false);
1905 octet_matrix.set_zero(); //init(true);
1906
1907 const_iterator it(this);
1908 for(; it.valid(); ++it)
1909 {
1910 const value_type* s = *it; // get asciiz char*
1911 if(!s)
1912 continue;
1913 for (unsigned i = 0; true; ++i) // for each char in str
1914 {
1915 value_type ch = s[i];
1916 if (!ch)
1917 break;
1918 typename
1919 octet_freq_matrix_type::value_type* row = octet_matrix.row(i);
1920 unsigned ch_idx = (unsigned char)ch;
1921 row[ch_idx] += 1;
1922 } // for i
1923 } // for it
1924
1925}
1926
1927//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1928
1929template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
1930void str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::build_octet_remap(
1931 slice_octet_matrix_type& octet_remap_matrix1,
1932 slice_octet_matrix_type& octet_remap_matrix2,
1933 octet_freq_matrix_type& octet_occupancy_matrix) const
1934{
1935 size_type max_str_len = effective_max_str();
1936 octet_remap_matrix1.resize(max_str_len, 256, false);
1937 octet_remap_matrix1.set_zero();
1938 octet_remap_matrix2.resize(max_str_len, 256, false);
1939 octet_remap_matrix2.set_zero();
1940
1941 for (unsigned i = 0; i < octet_occupancy_matrix.rows(); ++i)
1942 {
1943 typename octet_freq_matrix_type::value_type* frq_row =
1944 octet_occupancy_matrix.row(i);
1945
1946 unsigned char* remap_row1 = octet_remap_matrix1.row(i);
1947 unsigned char* remap_row2 = octet_remap_matrix2.row(i);
1948
1949 const typename slice_octet_matrix_type::size_type row_size =
1950 octet_occupancy_matrix.cols();
1951 for (unsigned remap_code = 1; true; ++remap_code)
1952 {
1953 typename octet_freq_matrix_type::size_type char_idx;
1954 bool found = bm::find_max_nz(frq_row, row_size, &char_idx);
1955 #if 0
1956 bool found = bm::find_first_nz(frq_row, row_size, &char_idx);
1957 #endif
1958 if (!found)
1959 break;
1960 BM_ASSERT(char_idx);
1961 unsigned char ch = (unsigned char)char_idx;
1962 remap_row1[remap_code] = ch;
1963 remap_row2[ch] = (unsigned char)remap_code;
1964 frq_row[char_idx] = 0; // clear the picked char
1965 } // for
1966 } // for i
1967}
1968
1969//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1970
1971template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
1972void str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::recalc_remap_matrix2()
1973{
1974 BM_ASSERT(remap_flags_);
1975
1976 auto rows = remap_matrix1_.rows();
1977 remap_matrix2_.resize(rows, remap_matrix1_.cols(), false);
1978 if (rows)
1979 {
1980 remap_matrix2_.set_zero();
1981 //remap_matrix2_.init(true);
1982 for (unsigned i = 0; i < remap_matrix1_.rows(); ++i)
1983 {
1984 const unsigned char* remap_row1 = remap_matrix1_.row(i);
1985 unsigned char* remap_row2 = remap_matrix2_.row(i);
1986 for (unsigned j = 1; j < remap_matrix1_.cols(); ++j)
1987 {
1988 if (remap_row1[j])
1989 {
1990 unsigned ch_code = remap_row1[j];
1991 remap_row2[ch_code] = (unsigned char)j;
1992 BM_ASSERT(ch_code < 256);
1993 }
1994 } // for j
1995 } // for i
1996 } // if rows
1997}
1998
1999//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2000
2001template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
2002bool str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::remap_tosv(
2003 value_type* BMRESTRICT sv_str,
2004 size_type buf_size,
2005 const value_type* BMRESTRICT str,
2006 const slice_octet_matrix_type& BMRESTRICT octet_remap_matrix2) BMNOEXCEPT
2007{
2008 for (unsigned i = 0; i < buf_size; ++i)
2009 {
2010 CharType ch = str[i];
2011 if (!ch)
2012 {
2013 sv_str[i] = ch;
2014 break;
2015 }
2016 const unsigned char* remap_row = octet_remap_matrix2.row(i);
2017 unsigned char remap_value = remap_row[unsigned(ch)];
2018 if (!remap_value) // unknown dictionary element
2019 return false;
2020 sv_str[i] = CharType(remap_value);
2021 } // for i
2022 return true;
2023}
2024
2025//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2026
2027template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned MAX_STR_SIZE>
2028bool str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, MAX_STR_SIZE>::remap_fromsv(
2029 value_type* BMRESTRICT str,
2030 size_type buf_size,
2031 const value_type* BMRESTRICT sv_str,
2032 const slice_octet_matrix_type& BMRESTRICT octet_remap_matrix1
2033 ) BMNOEXCEPT
2034{
2035 for (unsigned i = 0; i < buf_size; ++i)
2036 {
2037 CharType ch = sv_str[i];
2038 if (!ch)
2039 {
2040 str[i] = ch;
2041 break;
2042 }
2043 const unsigned char* remap_row = octet_remap_matrix1.row(i);
2044 unsigned char remap_value = remap_row[unsigned(ch)];
2045 if (!remap_value) // unknown dictionary element
2046 return false;
2047 str[i] = CharType(remap_value);
2048 } // for i
2049 return true;
2050}
2051
2052//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2053
2054template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned MAX_STR_SIZE>
2055void str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, MAX_STR_SIZE>::remap()
2056{
2057 // TODO: get rid of tmp, implement a move-remapping
2058 str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, MAX_STR_SIZE>
2059 sv_tmp(this->get_null_support());
2060 sv_tmp.remap_from(*this);
2061 sv_tmp.swap(*this);
2062}
2063
2064//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2065
2066template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
2067void
2068str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::remap_from(
2069 const str_sparse_vector& str_sv)
2070{
2071 if (str_sv.is_remap())
2072 {
2073 *this = str_sv;
2074 return;
2075 }
2076 this->clear_all(true);
2077 if (str_sv.empty()) // no content to remap
2078 return;
2079
2080 octet_freq_matrix_type omatrix; // occupancy map
2081 str_sv.calc_octet_stat(omatrix);
2082
2083 str_sv.build_octet_remap(remap_matrix1_, remap_matrix2_, omatrix);
2084 remap_flags_ = 1; // turn ON remapped mode
2085
2086 const unsigned buffer_size = ins_buf_size; // 1024 * 8;
2087
2088 typedef bm::dynamic_heap_matrix<CharType, allocator_type> buffer_matrix_type;
2089
2090 size_type str_len = str_sv.effective_max_str()+1;
2091 //remap_buffer_type cmatr(true);
2092 buffer_matrix_type cmatr(buffer_size, str_len);
2093 cmatr.init(true); // init and set zero
2094
2095 for (size_type i = 0; true; )
2096 {
2097 size_type dsize = str_sv.decode(cmatr, i, buffer_size, true);
2098 if (!dsize)
2099 break;
2100 this->import(cmatr, i, dsize);
2101 i += dsize;
2102 } // for i
2103
2104 if (bvector_type* bv_null = this->get_null_bvect())
2105 {
2106 if (const bvector_type* bv_null_arg = str_sv.get_null_bvector())
2107 *bv_null = *bv_null_arg;
2108 else
2109 {
2110 // TODO: exception? assert? maybe it is OK...
2111 }
2112 }
2113
2114}
2115
2116//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2117
2118template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
2119void str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::sync(bool /*force*/)
2120{
2121 if (remap_flags_)
2122 recalc_remap_matrix2();
2123}
2124
2125//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2126
2127template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
2128bool str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::equal(
2129 const str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>& sv,
2130 bm::null_support null_able) const BMNOEXCEPT
2131{
2132 // at this point both vectors should have the same remap settings
2133 // to be considered "equal".
2134 // Strictly speaking this is incorrect, because re-map and non-remap
2135 // vectors may have the same content
2136
2137 if (remap_flags_ != sv.remap_flags_)
2138 return false;
2139 if (remap_flags_)
2140 {
2141 // TODO: equal matrix dimention overlap may be not enough
2142 // (check the non-overlap to be zero)
2143 // dimentionality shrink is a result of de-serialization
2144 bool b;
2145 b = remap_matrix1_.equal_overlap(sv.remap_matrix1_);
2146 if (!b)
2147 return b;
2148 b = remap_matrix2_.equal_overlap(sv.remap_matrix2_);
2149 if (!b)
2150 return b;
2151 }
2152 return parent_type::equal(sv, null_able);
2153}
2154
2155//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2156
2157template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
2158void str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::copy_range(
2159 const str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>& sv,
2160 size_type left, size_type right,
2161 bm::null_support slice_null)
2162{
2163 if (left > right)
2164 bm::xor_swap(left, right);
2165 this->clear_all(true);
2166
2167 remap_flags_ = sv.remap_flags_;
2168 remap_matrix1_ = sv.remap_matrix1_;
2169 remap_matrix2_ = sv.remap_matrix2_;
2170
2171 this->copy_range_slices(sv, left, right, slice_null);
2172 this->resize(sv.size());
2173}
2174
2175//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2176
2177template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
2178str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>&
2179str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::merge(
2180 str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>& str_sv)
2181{
2182 size_type arg_size = str_sv.size();
2183 if (this->size_ < arg_size)
2184 resize(arg_size);
2185
2186 // there is an assumption here that we only need to copy remap flags once
2187 // because we merge matrices with the same remaps
2188 // otherwise - undefined behavior
2189 //
2190 if (remap_flags_ != str_sv.remap_flags_)
2191 {
2192 remap_flags_ = str_sv.remap_flags_;
2193 remap_matrix1_ = str_sv.remap_matrix1_;
2194 remap_matrix2_ = str_sv.remap_matrix2_;
2195 }
2196 bvector_type* bv_null = this->get_null_bvect();
2197
2198 this->merge_matr(str_sv.bmatr_);
2199
2200 // our vector is NULL-able but argument is not (assumed all values are real)
2201 if (bv_null && !str_sv.is_nullable())
2202 bv_null->set_range(0, arg_size-1);
2203
2204 return *this;
2205
2206}
2207
2208//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2209
2210template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
2211void str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::keep_range(
2212 size_type left, size_type right,
2213 bm::null_support slice_null)
2214{
2215 if (right < left)
2216 bm::xor_swap(left, right);
2217 this->keep_range_no_check(left, right, slice_null);
2218}
2219

2225{
2226 typedef typename
2227 str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::const_iterator it_type;
2228 return it_type(this);
2229}

2237 parent_type::clear_all(free_mem);
2238}

2293
2294template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
2295str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::const_iterator::const_iterator(
2296 const str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>* sv) BMNOEXCEPT
2297: sv_(sv), pos_(sv->empty() ? bm::id_max : 0), pos_in_buf_(~size_type(0))
2298{
2299 substr_from_ = 0;
2300 substr_to_ = (unsigned) sv_->effective_max_str();
2301 buf_matrix_.resize(n_rows, substr_to_+1);
2302}

2304//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2305
2306template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
2307str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::const_iterator::const_iterator(
2308 const str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>* sv,
2309 typename str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::size_type pos) BMNOEXCEPT
2310: sv_(sv), pos_(pos >= sv->size() ? bm::id_max : pos), pos_in_buf_(~size_type(0))
2311{
2312 substr_from_ = 0;
2313 substr_to_ = (unsigned) sv_->effective_max_str();
2314 buf_matrix_.resize(n_rows, substr_to_+1);
2315}
2316
2317//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2318
2319template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
2320void str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::const_iterator::set_substr(
2321 unsigned from, unsigned len) BMNOEXCEPT
2322{
2323 unsigned max_str = sv_->effective_max_str();
2324 substr_from_ = from;
2325 if (!len)
2326 {
2327 len = 1 + max_str - from;
2328 substr_to_ = from + len;
2329 }
2330 else
2331 {
2332 // TODO: check for overflow
2333 substr_to_ = substr_from_ + (len - 1);
2334 }
2335 if (max_str < substr_to_)
2336 substr_to_ = max_str;
2337 buf_matrix_.resize(n_rows, len+1, false/*no content copy*/);
2338}
2339
2340//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2341
2342template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
2343const typename str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::value_type*
2344str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::const_iterator::value() const
2345{
2346 BM_ASSERT(sv_);
2347 BM_ASSERT(this->valid());
2348
2349 if (pos_in_buf_ == ~size_type(0))
2350 {
2351 if (!buf_matrix_.is_init())
2352 buf_matrix_.init();
2353 pos_in_buf_ = 0;
2354 size_type d = sv_->decode_substr(buf_matrix_, pos_, n_rows,
2355 substr_from_, substr_to_);
2356 if (!d)
2357 {
2358 pos_ = bm::id_max;
2359 return 0;
2360 }
2361 }
2362 if (is_null())
2363 return 0;
2364 return buf_matrix_.row(pos_in_buf_);
2365}
2366
2367//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2368
2369template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
2370typename str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::const_iterator::string_view_type
2371str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::const_iterator::get_string_view() const
2372{
2373 BM_ASSERT(sv_);
2374 BM_ASSERT(this->valid());
2375
2376 if (pos_in_buf_ == ~size_type(0))
2377 {
2378 if (!buf_matrix_.is_init())
2379 buf_matrix_.init();
2380 pos_in_buf_ = 0;
2381 size_type d = sv_->decode_substr(buf_matrix_, pos_, n_rows,
2382 substr_from_, substr_to_);
2383 if (!d)
2384 {
2385 pos_ = bm::id_max;
2386 return string_view_type();
2387 }
2388 }
2389 if (is_null())
2390 return string_view_type();
2391 return string_view_type(buf_matrix_.row(pos_in_buf_));
2392}
2393
2394
2395//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2396
2397template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
2398void
2399str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::const_iterator::go_to(
2400 typename str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::size_type pos
2401 ) BMNOEXCEPT
2402{
2403 pos_ = (!sv_ || pos >= sv_->size()) ? bm::id_max : pos;
2404 pos_in_buf_ = ~~size_type(0);
2405}
2406
2407//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2408
2409template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
2410void
2411str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::const_iterator::advance() BMNOEXCEPT
2412{
2413 if (pos_ == bm::id_max) // nothing to do, we are at the end
2414 return;
2415 ++pos_;
2416
2417 if (pos_ >= sv_->size())
2418 this->invalidate();
2419 else
2420 {
2421 if (pos_in_buf_ != ~size_type(0))
2422 {
2423 ++pos_in_buf_;
2424 if (pos_in_buf_ >= n_rows)
2425 pos_in_buf_ = ~~size_type(0);
2426 }
2427 }
2428}
2429
2430//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2431//
2432//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2433
2434template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
2435str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::back_insert_iterator::back_insert_iterator() BMNOEXCEPT
2436: sv_(0), bv_null_(0), pos_in_buf_(~size_type(0)), prev_nb_(0)
2437{}
2438
2439//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2440
2441template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
2442str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::back_insert_iterator::back_insert_iterator(
2443 str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>* sv) BMNOEXCEPT
2444: sv_(sv), pos_in_buf_(~size_type(0))
2445{
2446 if (sv)
2447 {
2448 prev_nb_ = sv_->size() >> bm::set_block_shift;
2449 bv_null_ = sv_->get_null_bvect();
2450 unsigned esize = (unsigned) sv_->effective_max_str();
2451 if (esize < STR_SIZE)
2452 esize = STR_SIZE;
2453 buf_matrix_.init_resize(n_buf_size, esize);
2454 }
2455 else
2456 {
2457 bv_null_ = 0; prev_nb_ = 0;
2458 }
2459}
2460
2461//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2462
2463template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
2464str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::back_insert_iterator::back_insert_iterator(
2465const str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::back_insert_iterator& bi) BMNOEXCEPT
2466: sv_(bi.sv_), bv_null_(bi.bv_null_), buf_matrix_(bi.buf_matrix_.rows(), bi.buf_matrix_.cols()),
2467 pos_in_buf_(~size_type(0)), prev_nb_(bi.prev_nb_)
2468{
2469 BM_ASSERT(bi.empty());
2470}
2471
2472//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2473
2474template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
2475str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::back_insert_iterator::~back_insert_iterator()
2476{
2477 this->flush();
2478}
2479
2480//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2481
2482template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
2483bool
2484str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::back_insert_iterator::empty()
2485 const BMNOEXCEPT
2486{
2487 return (pos_in_buf_ == ~size_type(0) || !sv_);
2488}
2489
2490//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2491
2492template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
2493void str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::back_insert_iterator::flush()
2494{
2495 if (this->empty())
2496 return;
2497
2498 size_type imp_idx = sv_->size();
2499 sv_->import_no_check(buf_matrix_, imp_idx, pos_in_buf_+1, false);
2500 pos_in_buf_ = ~~size_type(0);
2501 block_idx_type nb = sv_->size() >> bm::set_block_shift;
2502 if (nb != prev_nb_)
2503 {
2504 // optimize all previous blocks in all planes
2505 sv_->optimize_block(prev_nb_);
2506 prev_nb_ = nb;
2507 }
2508}
2509
2510//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2511
2512template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
2513void str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::back_insert_iterator::add(
2514const typename str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::back_insert_iterator::value_type* v)
2515{
2516 if (!v)
2517 {
2518 this->add_null();
2519 return;
2520 }
2521 size_type buf_idx = this->pos_in_buf_; // offset in
2522 size_type sz = sv_->size();
2523
2524 this->add_value(v);
2525 if (bv_null_)
2526 bv_null_->set_bit_no_check(sz + buf_idx + 1);
2527}
2528
2529//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2530
2531template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
2532void str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::back_insert_iterator::add_null()
2533{
2534 /*size_type buf_idx = */this->add_value("");
2535}
2536
2537//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2538
2539template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
2540void str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::back_insert_iterator::add_null(
2541typename str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::back_insert_iterator::size_type count)
2542{
2543 for (size_type i = 0; i < count; ++i) // TODO: optimization
2544 this->add_value("");
2545}
2546
2547//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2548
2549template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
2550void
2551str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::back_insert_iterator::add_value(
2552const str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::back_insert_iterator::value_type* v)
2553{
2554 BM_ASSERT(sv_);
2555 BM_ASSERT(v);
2556 BM_ASSERT(buf_matrix_.rows()>0);
2557
2558 if (pos_in_buf_ >= buf_matrix_.rows()-1)
2559 {
2560 if (pos_in_buf_ == ~size_type(0) && (!buf_matrix_.is_init()))
2561 buf_matrix_.init();
2562 else
2563 this->flush();
2564 pos_in_buf_ = 0; buf_matrix_.set_zero();
2565 }
2566 else
2567 {
2568 ++pos_in_buf_;
2569 }
2570
2571 value_type* r = buf_matrix_.row(pos_in_buf_);
2572
2573 typename buffer_matrix_type::size_type i;
2574 typename buffer_matrix_type::size_type cols = buf_matrix_.cols();
2575 for (i = 0; i < cols; ++i)
2576 {
2577 r[i] = v[i];
2578 if (!r[i])
2579 return;
2580 } // for i
2581
2582 // string is longer than the initial size, matrix resize is needed
2583 for (cols = i; true; ++cols) // find the new length
2584 {
2585 if (!v[cols])
2586 break;
2587 } // for cols
2588
2589 // cols is now string length and the new mattrix size parameter
2590 buf_matrix_.resize(buf_matrix_.rows(), cols + 1);
2591
2592 r = buf_matrix_.row(pos_in_buf_);
2593 cols = buf_matrix_.cols();
2594 for (; i < cols; ++i)
2595 {
2596 r[i] = v[i];
2597 if (!r[i])
2598 return;
2599 } // for i
2600 BM_ASSERT(0);
2601}
2602
2603//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2604
2605template<class CharType, class BV, unsigned STR_SIZE>
2606void str_sparse_vector<CharType, BV, STR_SIZE>::sync_size() BMNOEXCEPT
2607{
2608 const bvector_type* bv_null = this->get_null_bvector();
2609 if (!bv_null)
2610 return;
2611 bool found = bv_null->find_reverse(this->size_);
2612 this->size_ += found;
2613}
